meanings.sent1: The dilutive nature of the water made the juice taste less sweet.
meanings.sent2: Adding more water to the solution had a dilutive effect on its concentration.
meanings.sent3: The dilutive power of the rain turned the once vibrant colors of the painting into a blurry mess.
meanings.sent4: Her constant negativity had a dilutive impact on the team's morale, slowly draining their enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The dilutive properties of the medication made it easier to swallow, but less effective in treating the illness.

meanings.definition: Having the quality of diluting or reducing the strength or value of something.
meanings.sent1: The dilutive solution made the paint color appear lighter than intended.
meanings.sent2: The dilutive nature of gossip can harm relationships by spreading misinformation.
meanings.sent3: The dilutive effect of too many cooks in the kitchen resulted in a tasteless dish.
meanings.sent4: His dilutive comments watered down the impact of her heartfelt apology.
meanings.sent5: The dilutive power of doubt can weaken even the strongest convictions.
